intro: Platycarphella, commonly known as the narrowleaf false nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its slender, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with four petals, typically in shades of yellow or white. It is native to regions of North America and thrives in moist, shady environments. Platycarphella is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
